From where you are running your tests.
If your test class file is located at 
/images
and you also are running JUnit command from
/images
then a path of "testcases//button.gif" specified in the code will 
find the required GIF file.

- Nils

--- In junit@y..., "Jacob Bowers" <jacob.bowers@e...> wrote:
> Hello -
> 
> When I run JUnit, where does it consider the top or root level 
directory?
> In other words, I specify where the program should look for certain 
files
> using something like : "/images/testcases/button.gif"
> 
> When running the application normally it looks on the drive where 
the JDK is
> installed.  When I run under the JUnit framework it does not seem 
to be able
> to find it.
> 
> Thanks!
> 
> Jacob D. Bowers
> Software Engineer
